subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
President Bush’s sweeping immigration plan is
  dead. The administration’s hard-fought legislation would have legalized
  millions of immigrants currently living in the country without requisite documentation,
  but as Sharyl Attkisson reports, the bill fell 14 votes short of going to a
  final vote – and despite the president’s major lobbying efforts
  on Capitol Hill, most of the opposition to the bill was from his own party.  
 
Chief White House correspondent Jim Axelrod will
  give us some perspective on what is going right, and the many more things
  that are going wrong for the Bush White House.
 
First it was pet food, then toy trains and then toothpaste.
  Now there are concerns about imports of shrimp and fish from China after repeated testing has shown samples
  were contaminated with potentially dangerous antibiotics not approved for use
  in U.S.
  farmed seafood. Bob Orr will report.
 
It’s been a bloody day in Iraq. A car bomb killed at least
  25 at a busy intersection in Baghdad
  and 20 decapitated bodies were found in a Sunni village southeast of the
  city. And the offensive north of Baghdad,
  in Baqouba, continues. Tonight, Lara Logan will show you video that tells the
  story of how troops in the Baqouba offensive are able to track down and
  capture suspected al Qaeda insurgents. 
 
Meanwhile, more than 2,100 firefighters are still
  battling the raging wildfire near Lake
    Tahoe, California. They’re
  fighting the blaze on two fronts, trying to keep it contained and away from
  densely populated subdivisions nearby. Bill Whitaker will have the latest.
 
Finally, that big, soaring symbol of America
  – and I don’t mean the Boeing 747 – is being taken back off
  the protected species list. The bald eagle has landed, John Blackstone will
  report.
 
Thanks and I hope you’ll join us tonight,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
